column6: Benefits provided to full-time employees that are not provided to temporary or part-time employees
column7: In Malaysia, Lynas offer flexible working hours for non-operation employees, maternity leave above statutory requirements, part-time work transition from maternity leave, paternity leave and health schemes. Lynas Malaysia also operates a childcare facility for the children of Lynas Malaysia team members.

column6: Parental leave
column13: Lynas values its people and recognizes the dignity that comes from fair compensation. The total pay for three weeks of parental leave to Lynas employees is with 12 months of continuous service to support their dependents where an employee's partner, de facto spouse, has given birth to a child and is the primary caregiver.

Occupation health and safety management system
Hazard identification, risk assessment, and incident investigation
column13: Lynas' safety reporting is aligned with the ISO 45001 (Occupational Health and Safety Management) guidelines for recording and reporting occupational injuries and illnesses. There were no workplace fatalities or prosecutions in FY23 across all operating sites (Malaysia and Western Australia).\t

column6: Hazard identification, risk assessment, and incident investigation
column13: Additional education and training initiatives to facilitate improved performance are ongoing. Further education and training are crucial to ensure that the extraction and processing of rare earths are conducted in an environmentally responsible and safe manner.

column6: Occupational health services
Worker participation, consultation, and communication on occupational health and safety
Worker training on occupational health and safety
Worker training on occupational health and safety
column13: First aid training is designed to equip individuals with the knowledge and skills needed to provide immediate and initial assistance in the event of an injury or illness. The primary goal of first aid is to preserve life, prevent the condition from worsening, and promote recovery until professional medical help arrives.

column6: Worker training on occupational health and safety
column13: Fire safety training is a comprehensive program to educate individuals on preventing, responding to, and managing fire-related emergencies. The primary goal of fire safety training is to enhance awareness, promote preparedness, and mitigate risks associated with fires.

column6: Programs for upgrading employee skills and transition assistance programs
column13: Lynas has a formal talent management process that includes mentoring succession planning and initiatives focused on skills development. Lynas employees participate in annual performance reviews, and each respective department manager works with their team members on development opportunities, with support from the People and Culture team.
